item.title: The Case Against Industry Experience
item.description: TL;DNR While having experience working in a professional setting is important, there's a danger to only hiring people with experience in your specific industry. Having a fresh set of eyes on something can be incredibly valuable/important, and helps combat bias and theory blindness. Good designers are expert learners. We expect to need to understand the nuances of a new area of expertise. For those that haven’t been keeping track, I recently (October 2017) moved from Madison, WI to Brooklyn, NY, and the difference in the tech industry between the two cities has been really interesting.
